__e: But good enough for a man when he's starving.
Back there, people are starving, and we're doing nothing.
That's all you ever say to me when you see me: "I'm starving"
I'm scared to death of you city people.
The truth is, you're scared shitless of going to that place, aren't you?
Haven't even earned me old man's beer money yet. He's sitting with his tongue hanging out!
Isn't there something that you're just dying to tell me?
The truth is, you're scared shitless of going to that place, aren't you?
- There's a man dying at my house.
How does it feel dying in the dirty middle of somebody else's love affair?
- Well who is dying here then?
Well, excuse me for living, but I'm dying here, and that gives me a really bad headache, OK?
A man could be dying here, and...

I mean, here's an eighty-two-year-old man who's very emotional, and, you know, if you go in one moment, and you see the person's dying, and you don't want them to die, and then a doctor comes out five minutes later and tells you they're in wonderful shape!
Why, I expected to find you dying, and you look better than I've seen you look for months.
My God. we are dying... and you still want to gamble!
It's like people who know they're dying and have to put everything in order first
- He's dying and I can't stop it.
He's dying and doing all this for us.
I know you're dying for it.
Until I was 80 I was combing geezers out of my blue rinse.
[Moody] Yeah, I'm dying for it right now. [Laughing]
We're just too busy. People are dying to get in here.
